title: Admission Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: 3 stages: • Phone interview with Hiring Recruiter • Face-to-face Zoom interview with previous Hiring Recruiter, Director of Admission, and Executive Director of Admissions • Another Zoom interview I interviewed for the position but only made it to the 2nd round. If you are a SCAD alum, I think that they will instantly pull your application. I received an email for the first round of interviews that day after my application was submitted. The phone interview was only 10 minutes and the recruiter was nice and provided a lot of information. Within two days, I got the next invite for round 2, and that interview was a bit difficult. Especially since I have worked in the SCAD admission as a student, I thought that some of the questions were kind of repetitive from my previous interview and only personal depending on your own experience and background. It was almost a week after my 2nd interview that I received an email about not making the final round. I felt like I had to express how "life-changing "and "amazing" SCAD was. For me personally, SCAD did help me in my journey to my career field and I'm grateful for my time there, but there are still cons and personal experiences that if I can be honest about in a non-professional setting, I would warn students and families about the true reality of attending. Because I was familiar with what parents actually wanted to hear and questions that they had asked me from a student perspective about attending SCAD, my answers focused on the fact that the amazing faculty and students are what actually make the school what it is, not the flashy events and experiences. Because not everyone will be able to attend or experience things like studying abroad in France/Hong Kong or going to SCAD Day prior to getting in (I didn't) and I don't want to sell something unrealistic to a bright-eyed eyed 17/18-year-old kid and their parents. I guess that was not what they were looking for in the role.
Interview Questions: What was your SCAD journey?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Over the course of one year, I had 4 interviews for 4 different positions. This last one has led me to write this review. 

The recruiter was amazing, he does his job well, and prepared me well for the interviews. The first is with the Dean and Director and recruiter for one hour. It went very well and I moved onto the next round - a teaching demonstration on a topic they give you one week out for 30 minutes to 8 people. Then after that, you meet for another 1.5 hour Q&A. To prepare this teaching demo you also have to prepare and submit: Homework, additional activities, and a list of additional readings and resources! 

They then immediately ask you to submit your transcripts and 3 written references to their credentialing department. I asked my network to do this for me, and paid to have my past colleges send transcripts. This step usually happens after you've received an offer so it felt like a real success. 

HR then sends you a list of housing, options neighborhoods where other faculty live, and many links to learn about housing and activities in Savannah. All great signs.

Then, I waited. 11 days. I wrote the recruiter, he called and told me I did not get the position. Just like that. 

After an entire year of many interviews, asking my network to go out of their way to stand up for me, the amount of days and time preparing the teaching demo, the transcripts, they honestly go out of their way to make you feel like you are the only candidate. I feel it was a process that greatly benefitted them, and not me. I feel used and actually told them to lose my number and throw out my resume, I had it.
Interview Questions: How would you expand upon this 30 minute teaching demo to a 2.5 hour class?

title: Creative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions:
I didn’t actually apply for this job, they found me. There was an initial phone interview with a not very professional sounding HR person, who made it clear that I shouldn’t have high expectations as far as compensation.  An hour long video interview with 3 people (which was postponed once to a later date) went fairly well, everyone was friendly, but there were immediate red flags, like them saying the job has poor life/work balance, and asking outdated questions like “tell us 5 things about yourself”. Then came the reddest flag: a spec project: an immortal practice which allows potential employers get free work from creative professionals. This practice, although looked down upon in the field, is still somewhat common with recent grads who are trying to get their foot in the door. Asking someone with 15+ years work experience for such a thing means a prospective employer is either looking to take advantage of you, is unable to judge an existing portfolio, or is simply trying to see how bendable (susceptive to workplace abuse) you are. 

I agreed to the project, thinking the gig sounds interesting enough. I should’ve known better. The actual project, which I expected to be fairly simple, was a massive, multilayered assignment that I could easily charge 10K for in the real world. Meanwhile I was asked for a cover letter two weeks after the interview. Strangely casual  emails with smiley faces also made me question professionalism of this group. By the time I was working on the project I knew I didn’t want the job, but went through with it since I gave a promise. I received a formal rejection letter on Friday morning. (HR people, don’t send these on Fridays, you are ruining people’s weekends). I am not upset that I didn’t get the job, I had some big concerns. I am however pretty angry by the amount of time and effort they demanded, and how used it made me feel.
Interview Questions: Are you OK with bad work/life balance

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is typically a series of steps that a company or organization takes to assess a candidate's suitability for a job or position. The specific process can vary depending on the company and the position, but it generally follows a similar structure. Application: The first step in the interview process is usually the submission of an application. This can be done online, through email, or in person, depending on the company. The application usually includes a resume, cover letter, and any other relevant documents or information. Screening: Once the application has been received, the company will typically review it to see if the candidate meets the basic requirements for the position. This may involve a quick phone screening or a review of the candidate's online presence, such as social media profiles. First Interview: If the candidate passes the screening stage, they will usually be invited for a first interview. This may be conducted in person, over the phone, or via video conferencing. The purpose of this interview is to get to know the candidate better, assess their qualifications and experience, and determine if they would be a good fit for the company. Additional Interviews: Depending on the position and the company, there may be additional interviews with other members of the team, the hiring manager, or senior executives. These interviews may be more focused on specific skills or experience, or they may be more general in nature to assess the candidate's overall fit. Assessments and Tests: Some companies may also require candidates to take assessments or tests to evaluate their skills or knowledge in a particular area. For example, a writing sample or coding test may be given to candidates for certain positions. Reference Checks: Before making a final decision, the company may also conduct reference checks to verify the candidate's work history and qualifications. Job Offer: If the candidate has successfully completed all the steps in the interview process and is deemed the best fit for the position, they will be offered the job. The company will typically provide an offer letter outlining the terms of employment, including salary, benefits, and start date.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why you chose this major?

title: Creative Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I first had a screener call with a SCAD recruiter. Although she was personable, I questioned her HR experience because she said to me, "you are exactly what the creative team needs", five minutes into our phone call. Her comment didn't seem very professional and was also setting my expectations pretty high when I hadn't even gone through the formal interview process yet. She also spoke at length about salary expectations, insinuating that I should be prepared for the salary to be low. When I asked the salary range for the position she said, "I can't discuss that unless you get the offer." However, she was insistent that I tell her what I wanted to make, even though I said I would prefer to learn more about the role before discussing salary.

When I made it to the next round, a Skype call was scheduled for 4pm with two directors of SCAD's creative agency. I received a text from the recruiter at 3pm, the day of the interview, asking if I could do the Skype "now at 3pm" and not 4pm. Apparently, the directors had wrapped their prior interviews early and wanted to do mine right away so they could leave earlier. I thought it was really forward and unprofessional to expect a candidate to jump and do an interview an hour earlier than scheduled, with no lead time. 

The two directors I interviewed with seemed unenthused and preoccupied. I had also learned, through my own research, that one of the directors (the person who would have been my direct supervisor) was leaving his position. I had come across his job title/description, on the SCAD career webpage, posted a day prior to my interview. I am not sure if that contributed to the interviewees appearing preoccupied, but I assume it contributed to the conversation feeling a bit lackluster since one of the directors had one foot out the door.

When I did my research on the recruiter, I learned she is a SCAD graduate, working in HR on the side as a recruiter, while also owning a fashion business. She had zero HR credentials on her LinkedIn profile. I would suggest to the higher ups at SCAD HR to make sure all of their staff are properly qualified to conduct interviews. Just because an employee is a graduate of your school does not mean they are qualified to handle HR responsibilities.

What drives you?
Have you seen our work?

When I asked about the aforementioned I was offered elusive answers. The interviewer seemed not to know or care. I am very disappointed with my experience and shall not offer my services to SCAD.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I've had a lot of faculty interviews over Skype this year, this was by far the weirdest. About 10-15 minutes. The talent search only asked a couple of questions, not the questions you would naturally think they would ask. When I asked a question their answer was general and unrelated. I left wondering if the connection was scrambled because the interviewer seemed just as confused as I. 

Honestly, I don't think they even looked at my resume, maybe skimmed it. I received the 'thanks but no thanks' email a few days later.  This is fine, but I left wondering why they had reached out in the first place.
Interview Questions: Do you grade?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: Many calls with the recruiter and many interviews. Dragged on for over 5 months.  Ultimately I got another job during the process so I took it before continuing on with who knows how much longer to wait on an answer... I figured if they had wanted me they would have sorted it out by then.
Interview Questions: Things like what makes a school stand out and be great, etc...

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It began with a Skype interview, which included a recruiter and manager from HR. It moved to an in-person interview with the same recruiter and the team I would be working with (unexpected panel interview). They stated that an assessment test would follow the second interview, but later informed me that they were not moving forward with me so it did not happen. I was honestly relieved. They were courteous, not kind, and clearly maintain a very strict, tense, and downright stuffy atmosphere at all times.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time where you had a conflict with a coworker.

How do you handle pressure and deadlines?

How would you react if someone corrected your work?

What would you do if you had two projects that were due on the same day?

title: Docent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone call to arrange when best to meet. Met in the museum cafe. Kindly asked several questions regarding art, and what the position entailed. Interviewer was mostly interested in seeing how you were as a person and if your intentions were legitimate for getting the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I don’t know how much later, but I was scheduled for an over the phone interview. The interviewer was a bore, so yeah I was rejected. I do know what she was looking for, but I do know from the interview, she did not have those very things herself. She was the typical pretty white female with no previous experience that SCAD loves to hire.
Interview Questions: Questions pertaining to administrative experience

title: Fashion Technology Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview, and a sewing test with in person interview. Sewing test included stitching a fly front on industrial machines and adjusting darts on a flat pattern.
Interview Questions: How would you calm a distressed student?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with 2 people. They just asked me about my ability to work under pressure, people skills, how I dealt with difficult people or situations, if I was good at planning, so on and so forth.
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. It had all of the questions a person would expect for an interview for a  role like this. Literally, just google RA interview questions. Be ready to talk about program ideas.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with being on duty?

title: Summer Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervisor after emailing back and forth a bit, answered hypothetical scenario based questions and shared info about myself. Was not officially offered the job on the spot but it seemed pretty certain.
Interview Questions: How would you react to a parent that is experiencing a frustrating move-in day with their child, who takes out their anger on you?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed once over the phone, and then a second interview over Skype. Normal interview process. Asked questions regarding my background, my qualifications and what I can bring to the dynamic team at SCAD
Interview Questions: What can you bring to SCAD that we don't have yet

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview- the interviewer split the time (30 minutes) as her half and my half to ask questions/converse. She asked about my previous experience and specific SCAD knowledge so be prepared to know some facts and be confident in talking about htem.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect of this position that you believe would be a challenge to you?

title: Illustration Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewer was really kind and understanding. They were interested in hiring somebody with experience in digital illustration and new media. It was great that they did not only asked questions about my background, but also they talked about what SCAD has to offer to students as well as to the Faculty.

After the interview I had to fill out the online application just to be sure my application was registered. However, I never got a confirmation wether my application was received or not, and, if turned down, why.
Interview Questions:
- What is my background?
- Do I have experience with digital painting and new media?
- What is my opinion about the use of technology to make art?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two Skype sessions about a week or so apart, and then an on-campus interview. Total process took about 4-5 weeks. The Skype interviews were about 45 minutes, and the on-campus was 27 minutes total. Skype interview was very in-depth about approaches to recruitment and moving from a student development role into recruiting, and more about my goals as a professional. On-campus consisted of four people including the Staff Recruiter. I was asked to prepare a five-minute presentation imagining that my audience consisted of high school students who knew nothing about SCAD. Was asked generic questions about how to build relationships with students, how I feel about speaking in front of large crowds, had my presentation, and then was able to ask one follow question of my own. The staff recruiter is amazing. Extremely personal, gets to know you as a person, and really appreciates you as an applicant - something I don't see very often. However, the on-campus interview itself felt very impersonal. I could tell they had several interviews lined up that afternoon and was shocked that it only took half an hour. Most higher ed on-campus interviews consist of an agenda for the entire day/afternoon. I walked away pretty much knowing I didn't get the job. After three days, I received the standard HR e-mail confirming so. Overall, I was impressed with the process until the actual panel interview.
Interview Questions: What is your approach to recruiting students on a personal level?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Had a phone interview slated for 30 minutes. I did not get a Skype like the others so I guess that meant I wasn't getting selected, but I did not know that at the time. She asked me to recite my resume and cut me off mid stream. Then she asked me to say why I wanted to work for SCAD and I gave her a escalator speech. Then she said, "you're right about SCAD being great... but looking at your resume, good stuff but its, idk, overqualified???" I'm sorry, it's rude and don't try this at home, but I had to agree with her so I just hung up the phone.

She must have known that I applied for three different positions with SCAD and was only over qualified for one of them. Guess I just wanted to see where I fit in, but I could have been interviewed for either of the other two if she felt like that. The point is, that wasn't really fair because I was interviewed for something she already knew I wasn't eligible for. your resume has to go through her first before it goes past her to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Transfer Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position about a month prior to my interview. I received a call from an HR recruiter to schedule a Skype interview for the following day. The recruiter sent an email with her Skype id. I skyped the recruiter the following day and I have to say, the recruiter was anything but pleasant. She  asked a lot of questions that seemed a bit unnecessary and I feel like she was trying to stump me. She sighed a lot and seemed annoyed and unimpressed with most of my answers. Lots of eye rolls, as well. Clearly this recruiter either has poor people skills or just didn't like me for whatever reason.  I honestly am glad I was not chosen for this position because having her an my interviewee was a terrible first impression of SCAD for me.
Interview Questions: If you put in blood, sweat and tears for a Psychology degree, why would you want a career in higher education?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Three part process. One Skype, then second is with the training director and HR, then the third is a presentation you have to give as if you were giving a presentation for interested students. The third interview is with all the upper management of admissions.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to travel on the drop of a hat

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: They were late...twice.  Good to mediocre questions, no dialogue, lighting was so bad I couldn't see faces. Seemed to go well twice...then months went by no contact.  I was told early on I was a top candidate, so the silence seemed contadictiry.  Never received a thank you for your time email, which is a proper university courtesy.  I wish them luck in their search, but as a seasoned worker in the field, I was left hanging and if the remote chance they would contact me, I'd be wary.
Interview Questions: Why do I want the position...how would I deal with conflict.

title: Assistant Director of Enrollment (Admissions Advisor) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position in early March and was contacted by HR in late May. The interview process took two and a half weeks. I first did a Skype interview with HR, then an in-person interview with the Director of Enrollment and an HR member, and a final interview with the Director of Admissions and an HR member that included a 5-7 minute presentation. The final interview also included lunch with two current ADEs.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at SCAD?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview within a week of applying. The first interview was a quick interview with a staff recruiter over on Skype. Probably lasted 10 minutes. It was a pleasant interview. I was told that she was happy enough with me and that a recommendation would be made to go to the next level. Few days later I had the second interview with the same recruiter and the head of admissions. It was done over Skype too. However, since then it's been at least 6 weeks and I have had no contact, not even courtesy email. Quite disappointing!
Interview Questions: Why did you choose SCAD

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for three different administrative assistant positions and received an email within two business days with a request for a telephonic interview for only one of them. The HR representative called me as scheduled. I asked which department the position was located (it was not listed on the site) and was given the location. Through the course of the interview, I found out the interviewer was handling all three positions to which I coincidentally applied. Upon hearing the information, I asked if the interview was just for that one position. She said, "Yes." I was asked a few questions and was disappointed to hear a smug chortle when she heard my response that my work experience is greater than my degrees. I asked a few questions to which she said she couldn't answer - simple questions about benefits. I received an emailed letter of rejection the next morning and then with the next few days received rejection letters for the other two positions for which I was not even interviewed (but she was handling. I was rather shocked to be rejected for a position which would pose no more challenging than handling my own family affairs on a daily basis. I decided to do research on the interviewer and found that she is relatively young and without a doubt does not have enough work or life experience to judge anybody's capabilities for a simple desk job. During my search, I located information on this site about the company and have determined that not being offered a job must be a blessing in disguise.
Interview Questions: How do your recent degrees directly apply to the position you applied for? (Yes, this is how she worded the question, not me. I know that a sentence is not supposed to end with a preposition!)

title: Enrollment Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received a call from HR one week later to set up a Skype interview. The first interview lasted about 30 minutes. She only gave me the opportunity to ask one question at the end, but immediately set up a second Skype interview.

The second Skype interview included the same HR person and two people from the hiring department. It was only 20 minutes long and they interrupted me 15 minutes in to say that there was a bad connection and they'd need to finish the interview over the phone. Once again, I was instructed that they only had time for one question. They told me they'd be in touch by the end of the week. During my two interviews there was a lot of emphasis on how many hours I'd be willing to work with the understanding that it would sometimes be above 40. I got the impression that it would be well beyond 40 hours on a regular basis given how much attention they were giving to that particular aspect of one of my previous jobs.

Sometime the following week, I received an email from the same HR woman stating that they'd decided not to consider me for the position - but it was for a different position at the Atlanta campus. My status is listed as "Not Hired" for that position and I'm still "In Process" for the original job, which I assume is an error.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at SCAD?

title: Enrollment Events Manager - Tours Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with HR rep. One week later HR rep called to set up face to face interview. Face to face included HR rep, director & manager and lasted about 45 minutes. Very formal, structured interview process. Over qualified for position.
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
Why do you want to work for SCAD?
What question were you expecting us to ask?

title: Orientation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is set up like a mini Career Fair (at the time anyways). It was open and comfortable. Definitely taught you how to focus while being surrounded by many moving parts. Also, since it was open downstairs, you had the opportunity to talk to other students. Helped diffuse tension a bit.
Interview Questions: Questions were typical. Tend to ask about experiences in leadership and interactions with coworkers.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy-going and laid back. It only lasted about five minutes and the woman was incredibly sweet and bubbly. Went in, she asked about my experience with the school and what I would want to change about it.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing about SCAD?

title: Alumni Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: They pulled my application from another position I applied for. After one phone interview and two in person interviews they waited two weeks before calling me back to advise that they are closing the position because they were changing the job description and requirements. This was over the course of almost 3 months and the communication was very positive the entire time until the final call. They obviously did not know what they were looking for and wasted my time from the very beginning. I will not apply for another position at SCAD because of how they treat potential employees. The recruiter was very nice but would go weeks without responding to emails or voice-mails. The whole process was not professional.
Interview Questions: What skills from your current position do you think align with this position?

title: Student Success Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: About 9 weeks after submitting my application I had a phone interview with HR.  Two days later I had a Skype interview with HR and two supervisors in the department, followed by another phone interview with another supervisor and two managers in the department.  (I live in another state)
Interview Questions: Tell us about your financial aid experience.

title: Financial Aid Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, after several months received a phone interview, didn't receive an in-person interview until they knew I moved to Savannah, GA. Once they knew I had moved they offered an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What are your 5 year goals?

title: Promotional Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: not professional. the HR and the hiring managers interviewed me all at once in one room. I didn't know whether to get more specific on the job details or answer HR types of questions!!! they mostly talked about them selves!!
Interview Questions: What software do you use?

title: Staffer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Typical phone interview, in person interview, then return for 3rd interview.  Entire process took approximately 1 month from beginning to end.  I was offered the position and excepted.
Interview Questions: Future Goals and where do you see yourself in 5 years, 10 years.  Also I was asked the same questions each step of the way (during the phone interview, and both in person interviews).

title: UI/User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the website of SCAD. The process took 2+ weeks. A initial phone Interview. One phone interview. They asked solid questions that were related to the job. But they were very nice.  They told me after one week, I will get the answer. But until two weeks later, I still did not get any feedback.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: Phone call followed by an in-person interview with direct boss and boss's boss. It was fairly casual as far as an interview goes and went section by section over my resume. I received a phone call with an offer shortly afterwards.
Interview Questions: What web development technologies have you worked with?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely painful because they required so many documents that don't seem that necessary. I sometimes really wonder if they look at all documents. You also have to attend a workshop that takes whole day (usually Friday or weekend) which is exhausting and they have a current RA evaluating you.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Art Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Too many steps to the process and very slow to respond. Took 3 months total from start to finish and long gaps of not hearing anything back. Not good at describing the actual benefits you will receive. Very miss leading.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current role.

title: Researcher/Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First, I was asked to do a standard phone interview with someone in the HR department. Second, I had a Skype interview with the HR representative and someone from the department that was filling the position. Next, I was asked to submit a writing sample based on a prompt that the HR representative sent me. Finally, I was asked to travel to an in-person interview in Savannah. 

I would say that overall, the experience was very informal. During the lunch/in-person interview, those on the hiring committee cursed (not heavily, but enough for me to note it).
Interview Questions: Q: How do you work on a project that doesn't interest you?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: Ridiculous. Slowest process ever over  months. 4 interviews, lunch interview and an offer. I wanted to negotiate parts of my contract, and suddenly had the offer rejected by an HR rep I had never met with or spoken to during the entire process. No explanation or reasoning. What a joke. Completely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Describe how you organize a work load that seems unmanageable

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Montpelier, VT) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process started as a phone call by HR to set up a time. She told me one time, and then emailed me a confirmation of a different time. I emailed back with no response. Since the interview was through skype, I waited around for almost an hour. once they finally called in, the questions were very scripted, it was not conversational.
Interview Questions: Why would you tell a student to come to SCAD?

title: Motion Graphics Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Last more than thirty minutes and asked a lot very professional questions. It was very interesting, and insightful. It was ok during the process. They were very interested in my internship experience and asked a lot about that.
Interview Questions: Could you tell your background

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took place over two days. The first day was in person individual interviews with resident directors and community assistants. It involved questions, responses, and turning in supplemental materials that were asked to be brought. The second day was groups processing where we worked with other potential hires to see how we worked together. It involved going to different rooms with different challenges to see how we would react.
Interview Questions: Which Residence Hall would you prefer to work at?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Everything went pretty smoothly until they asked me to negotiate salary. I must have come across as too bold or too inexperienced with this. They said they were willing to have me think about it for 24-48 hours and get back to them. Early this morning, before I made my decision, I got an email from them saying that they had decided "not to proceed further with your candidacy." Based on the reviews that I got from workers in this school, I am not surprised about their dismissive attitude. It sounds like they did me a favor in the long run as I wouldn't want to work for this exploitative company.
Interview Questions: tell me about your salary expectations.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point. They will ask some questions that may really stump you, but its important to try to remain calm and patiently think of a decent answer. Answering with something is better than being silent (so long as it's a somewhat intelligent response). Will mostly ask about how you would respond to 'this' or 'that' situation.
Interview Questions: What is your method of handling conflict, and can you give an example from your experience?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical: Presented to a class, toured facilities, interviewed with Dean, Dept Chair and HR staff. Had lunch with Dean and coffee with faculty. The facilities on the campus tour were impressive, all staff were prepared and helpful answering questions, and it had a great energy. All was well organized.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to join SCAD?
Which classes would be good fit for you to teach?
What is relationship to the profession, business contact, how do you stay relevant.
Nothing unusual.

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening and panel interview. Human resources staff member and three career advisors were in the interview. Tough interview questions. Well experienced for the position but did not receive it. More experience than those interviewing me. Some members were Snobby and self absorbed. Quick response that was within days from phone screen to interview and results.
Interview Questions: How do you like to be managed?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line with a resume and cover letter. I was contacted by HR for a group interview.I was called in for an interview with 4 employees. They were very nice. We discussed what the position entails and what my daily job functions would be.  Overall it was a great interview and I would recommend anyone to apply.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know my back ground and what I had experience in.

title: Communications/Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process took about six weeks, and included a phone, Skype, and in person interview. The phone interview was with the recruiter, the Skype included my potential boss and her boss, and the in person was with the recruiter and my boss.
Interview Questions: What attracted me to SCAD.

title: Admission Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It starts with a call from human resources, then a call with your boss and immediate supervisor, then an interview with the assistant director of admissions, and finally an interview with the director of admissions
Interview Questions: 10 minute presentation about the school

title: Clc Visual Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: Just simple process. Question 1: Tell me about yourself.Question 2: What is your strength? Question 3: What is your weakness? Question 4: Why do you think you can qualify this job? The lady was very friendly and I feel no pressure at all. And after interview, she even showed me around and showed the kitchen to me and gave me a bottle of water.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: This was for a work-study part-time position. I applied through the student portal and got contacted to come in for an interview. It was quick and not as stressful as I was expecting it to be.
Interview Questions: What does being punctual mean to you?

title: Senior Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in-person interview with a recruiter. Directions to the facility were very poor and I had to park and ask directions from students how to get into the building. Had a very positive interview with a recruiter who assured me I was well-qualified and encouraged me to contact her to inquire about the status of the position. She never returned my calls.
Interview Questions: What would I bring to a new team for Video Production?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed once via Skype and once in person. They were hiring for two different departments, so I met with both. Then they asked me which I would rather end up with, which was the one I ended up working for. My only complaint was that the time elapsed from final interview to job offer was too long (about 60 days).
Interview Questions: How well do you think you will work in a team?

title: GM - SCAD Radio Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with former GM and Student Media Adviser to interview for position. It was a relatively laid-back interview, with questions one would expect to be asked. If you're familiar with the station at all and passionate about advancing it, the interview should be a piece of cake.
Interview Questions: What opportunities do you think there are for SCAD Radio to collaborate?

title: Mobility Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very informal but professional.  It contained a on-line application and an multiple  interviewing panel for possible candidates in order to analyze their potential. The manner of the interviewing was a first step in order to conclude with the final one, based on the meet and greet of the actual student that I was going to work with in order to assist them.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a student with physical disabilities in need of assistance?

title: Admission Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: After I applied online, I was asked to a phone interview.  It was 20-30 minutes long and very positive--the HR person was very friendly and also answered my questions very openly.  I was then asked for an in-person interview, which involved the admissions director and the same HR person. The questions were pretty easy in that they were the typical interview questions, so if you are prepared for those, you should be fine.  Then, I was asked for another in person interview with another HR person and the VP of admissions. I had to do a presentation, and the interview was a bit more awkward than the other two--sometimes repetitive, unclear questions were asked, and I wasn't sure exactly what they were asking or how to respond.  Still, the people were very friendly, and made sure to emphasize aspects of the job that would not be ideal for some people.
Interview Questions: Why should a student come to SCAD in particular?

title: SCAD Moa Docent Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the operations manager, first send resume and cover letter and received follow up email for an in person interview. The interview was right next to the museum, and it lasted for approximately 30 minutes. We discussed my education focus and then linked it to why I was interested in this opportunity as a docent.
Interview Questions: Asked me about prior experiences - failures and successes in projects. Also talked about former jobs and experiences that I could describe, highlights and low points - things that I have learned. The last part of the interview was about the Museum, questions like what my favorite exhibition had been and why I was seeking this position as a docent.

title: English Language Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I just sent in a resumé and was asked to interview.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student with absolutely no English skills whatsoever?

title: 6-Month Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design
Interview Descriptions: I found this position through the college website. I got an e-mail from them offering to meet with me for an interview. I told them that I was interested and went in for an interview. It was quite interesting because the guy came out and asked me to fill out a four page personality test. He told me there are no wrong answers, so I just took my time and tried to fill it out to the best of my abilities. It was quiet while I was doing this, so it felt a little bit awkward. There were two people for the interview, and they seemed pretty relaxed and very kind. After I finished they just asked me to talk a little about myself, my strengths and weaknesses, some examples of how I solved some difficult problems, and whether I had any questions about the school or position. Overall, it wasn't a bad interview and the interviewers were very kind and attentive. I haven't heard back from them, but I don't think I really made an impression on them. It's difficult to make an impression on them in 30 minutes. I think it's important to show that you're adaptable in a fast paced environment and you're creative.
Interview Questions: Give an example when you creatively solved a problem.

title: Professor of Animation Interview

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Savannah College of Art and Design (Savannah, GA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process starts through the colleges online hiring website, where the applicant is required to provide a resume and then to follow up by signing up for an interview. (Note: The position of Resident Assistant is only hired for in February and March, there are exceptions to the rule like applying for a position in the summer after working for either the Summer Seminars Assistant Position or the Rising Stars Assistant position) On the day of the interview you are required to bring a printed version of your resume and a cover letter. They recommend bring a program or bulletin board guide and a series of question but they don't really care. You will be interviewed by two people one current staff member in the Resident Assistant position and then by a Full time Savannah College of Art and Design employee. The second part of the process happens one or two weeks later and its called Group Process and its purpose is to see how you work in a team environment and to test how your disposition as a leader.
Interview Questions: The question don't matter, the answers do. Target your answer towards creating community, encouraging self improvement, promoting cultural diversity and your previous leadership roles. as long as you have a couple anecdotes for these target areas you are good. As for Group Process I have been an interviewer in the past and what really mattered that you could talk casually and clearly, it also helps that you don't say anything anti-semitic, sexist, racist, or discriminatory in any other facility because you may as well just throw away your chances of getting a job right there.

title: Model Interview

title: Shop Monitor Interview

title: Career Adviser Interview
